title: Mum catches moment men threaten to kidnap daughter for her phone on Facebook Live video
text:

A mum caught the moment she was robbed in the park on a Facebook Live video she was taking of her three young children.

Two men threatened to kidnap Susana Posada's two-year-old daughter in exchange for her phone as she went for an evening walk through Cottonwood Park in Richardson, Texas.

Mrs Posada was crossing a small bridge with a buggy as her two older children walked ahead of her when a man, dressed in black, grabbed for her phone.

He can be seen in the footage standing on the bridge ahead of her, while another man, also dressed in black, walks towards her.

(Image: Fox 4)

(Image: Fox 4)

As Mrs Posada passed the first man suspect, he allegedly grabbed for her phone while the other man picked up her daughter and reportedly threatened to take her unless the mother gave up her phone.

“As soon as she let go of the phone, the other guy just dropped the baby like to the floor. And the baby started crying,” said Lourdes Salinas, Posada’s mother-in-law.

Posada was still able to share a recording of the post as it had uploaded onto Facebook already.

(Image: Richardson Police)

(Image: Fox 4)

Richardson Police Department are now hunting for the two suspects following the incident at around 6pm on Monday.

Richardson Police Sergeant Kevin Perlich told Fox 4 : "As she’s crossing over the bridge, she’s confronted by two young, mid to late teen, black males who want her cell phone.

“When she kind of resists giving the phone, they grab one of the children."

(Image: Google Streetview)

(Image: Fox 4)

Police are working on a sketch of the attempted kidnappers.

Posada says in the future, she will avoid being on her device in public, and she won’t go back to that park.
description: Susana Posada caught the horrifying ordeal on camera as she was filming her three children walking through a park in Richardson, Texas, during an evening walk
